info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 18 at 5:04PM MDT until March 18 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Central Chaves County in southeastern New Mexico...
* Until 900 PM MDT.
* At 504 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was located between Roswell and Lake Arthur, and was stationary.
HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* Locations impacted include... Roswell, Dexter, Hagerman, Bottomless Lakes State Park, Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge, Lake Arthur, Midway, Roswell Correctional Facility and Greenfield.
This includes the following highways... Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 170. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 79 and 121. State Road 2 and Highway 70.
Near zero visibility is possible along the Roswell Relief route between Sunset and Brasher. Use an alternate route. Please avoid this area.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 9:00 PM MDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 9:00 PM MDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 18 at 5:04PM MDT until March 18 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 9:00 PM MDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 9:00 PM MDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.
